name: Chiltern Escarpment and Woodland Walk, Central Chilterns

ai.summary: A challenging long-distance hike along the Chiltern Escarpment and surrounding woodlands in the Central Chilterns, UK. The route covers about 54.4 km with a mix of exposed ridge sections, shaded woodlands, and hedgerow tracks, offering distant views and a true endurance challenge.
ai.terrain_summary: The walk combines chalk escarpment paths with woodland and field-edge tracks. Expect steep climbs and descents, uneven surfaces, occasional mud, and gates or stiles. Surface quality varies from compact chalk to overgrown paths; some sections may be exposed to wind.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard 54.4 km route. Plan for multi-day pacing or long day trips if you’re fit; check forecast and daylight hours. Chalk and muddy sections can be slippery; navigation using map and compass or GPS is advised. Carry ample water and food, a first aid kit, a charged phone and portable charger, a whistle, and weather-appropriate clothing. Inform someone of your plan and expected return; in emergencies call 999. Be mindful of rights of way, livestock, and farm hazards; be prepared for remote sections with limited signal.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a waterproof outer shell
Backpack with capacity for 2–3 litres of water
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Sunscreen, hat and sunglasses, plus insect repellent
ai.best_seasons: Spring and Autumn are ideal, offering mild weather and good visibility; Summer provides long daylight hours but can be hotter; Winter conditions are more challenging.

seo.title: Chiltern Escarpment and Woodland Walk – 54.4 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle the 54.4 km Chiltern Escarpment and Woodland Walk in the Central Chilterns, UK. Hard-distance route with rocky and woodland terrain, safety tips, gear checklist, and best seasons.
